zone.line: Seeking the object of another's fear
And others as with steps towards the tomb
Dragging his weary limbs intent
Watched Pored on
And others so trodden beneath,
Watching, the mangled worms that crawled below
mournfully
And some others miserably within the gloom
own walked,
Of their shadow sate, and called it death ...

line.del: But many more or slow or swift pursued

zone.line: And some fled from it as it were a ghost,
Half fainting with
in the affliction of vain breath.
But more with motions which each other crost
the clouds threw
Pursued or shunned the shadows of pale
Or birds within the noonday ether lost,
Upon that path where flowers never grew;
And faint for thirst & weary with vain toil
whose
Heard not the fountains of melodious dew
cells
mossy caves forever
Out of thier ivied caverns ever burst

line.del: Nor saw the landscape on which they had perish
